intro: Alonsoa mathewsii, commonly known as the Mathews' alonsoa, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of western South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring woody stems and narrow, leathery leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a range of colors from white to pink. Alonsoa mathewsii is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
